entry.value:
{"id":"2340b031-674a-4a0f-8bc4-7ccbea869bb1","name":"Gradle Settings Error: Missing Semicolon in Credentials Block","timestamp":1748271115800,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"<additional_data>
<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
settings.gradle.kts
```kotlin:settings.gradle.kts
 url 'https://artifact.bytedance.com/repository/pangle'
 }
 maven {
 url 'https://artifactory.apero.vn/artifactory/gradle-release/'
 credentials {
 username "software-inhouse"
 password "apero@123"

```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>
</additional_data>


<user_query>
For the code present, we get this error:
```
Unexpected tokens (use ';' to separate expressions on the same line)
```
How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"thinking","thinking":"The error "Unexpected tokens (use ';' to separate expressions on the same line)" typically occurs in Kotlin (or Kotlin DSL files like settings.gradle.kts) when there's a syntax issue. 

Looking at the code, I notice that the URL strings in the maven repository declarations are using single quotes ('). In Kotlin, string literals should use double quotes (").

For example, these lines:
```kotlin
maven { url 'https://jitpack.io/' }
```

Should be:
```kotlin
maven { url = uri("https://jitpack.io/") }
```

For a proper Kotlin DSL syntax in settings.gradle.kts, we need to:
1. Use double quotes (") instead of single quotes (') for strings
2. Use proper assignment with "url = uri(...)" syntax

Let me propose a fix for all the maven repositories in the file.","signature":"EqoBCkgIAxABGAIiQPUYTXq4gAU3CikLA4v3TEGK5128fZ/8RwEQKci9kXPcKcvdA0+M0Cw65eRvmd8q32sPZvoqkjVRyGHhfbcSvqUSDGMSM8P71F73l2IF2xoMDLEco4jtI4yjgL/9IjCduO0A+C1z3VlNsWAwQ+nC3TfH+99CkJkanXAS4id2MVc2ULR88L+olh9KFqL2zZkqEJ9VzyApEAsvYtTj92r2Ds8="},{"type":"text","text":"The problem is that you're using single quotes (') for strings in a Kotlin DSL file. In Kotlin, strings must use double quotes (") and URL assignments need proper syntax."}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01SNVi7UVEpqDxUm8tP1dyzH","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"target_file": "settings.gradle.kts", "instructions": "I will fix the string quotes and URL assignment syntax in the gradle file.", "code_edit": "@@ ... @@\n repositories {\n google()\n mavenCentral()\n maven { url = uri(\"https://jitpack.io/\") }\n maven {\n url = uri(\"https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/\")\n }\n maven {\n url = uri(\"https://maven.google.com\")\n }\n maven {\n url = uri(\"https://dl-maven-android.mintegral.com/repository/mbridge_android_sdk_oversea\")\n }\n maven {\n url = uri(\"https://artifact.bytedance.com/repository/pangle\")\n }\n maven {\n url = uri(\"https://artifactory.apero.vn/artifactory/gradle-release/\")\n credentials {\n username = \"software-inhouse\"\n password = \"apero@123\"\n }\n }\n }"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01SNVi7UVEpqDxUm8tP1dyzH","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,3 +1,2 @@
-
 pluginManagement {
 repositories {
@@ -12,22 +11,23 @@
 google()
 mavenCentral()
- maven { url 'https://jitpack.io/' }
+ maven { url = uri("https://jitpack.io/") }
 maven {
- url 'https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/'
+ url = uri("https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/")
 }
 maven {
- url "https://maven.google.com"
+ url = uri("https://maven.google.com")
 }
 maven {
- url "https://dl-maven-android.mintegral.com/repository/mbridge_android_sdk_oversea"
+ url =
+ uri("https://dl-maven-android.mintegral.com/repository/mbridge_android_sdk_oversea")
 }
 maven {
- url 'https://artifact.bytedance.com/repository/pangle'
+ url = uri("https://artifact.bytedance.com/repository/pangle")
 }
 maven {
- url 'https://artifactory.apero.vn/artifactory/gradle-release/'
+ url = uri("https://artifactory.apero.vn/artifactory/gradle-release/")
 credentials {
- username "software-inhouse"
- password "apero@123"
+ username = "software-inhouse"
+ password = "apero@123"
 }
 }
@@ -36,3 +36,3 @@
 rootProject.name = "testAi"
 include(":app")
- 
+
```

The edit was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

The error is fixed. I converted all string values to use double quotes, which is required in Kotlin DSL files, and changed the URL assignment syntax to use the proper `url = uri()` format. The credentials were also updated to use the assignment operator."}]}]}

Now I'll create the SharedPref class for storing and retrieving preferences:"}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01TAWR5RmCpGcdx4cGbLxFA2","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"target_file": "app/src/main/java/com/apero/testai/SharedPref.kt", "instructions": "I'm creating a SharedPref class for managing SharedPreferences in the Android app", "code_edit": "package com.apero.testai\n\nimport android.content.Context\nimport android.content.SharedPreferences\nimport androidx.core.content.edit\nimport androidx.preference.PreferenceManager\n\nclass SharedPref private constructor(context: Context) {\n private val prefs: SharedPreferences = PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(context.applicationContext)\n \n companion object {\n @Volatile\n private var instance: SharedPref? = null\n \n fun getInstance(context: Context): SharedPref {\n return instance ?: synchronized(this) {\n instance ?: SharedPref(context).also { instance = it }\n }\n }\n }\n \n // String preferences\n fun setString(key: String, value: String) {\n prefs.edit { putString(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getString(key: String, defaultValue: String = \"\"): String {\n return prefs.getString(key, defaultValue) ?: defaultValue\n }\n \n // Int preferences\n fun setInt(key: String, value: Int) {\n prefs.edit { putInt(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getInt(key: String, defaultValue: Int = 0): Int {\n return prefs.getInt(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Boolean preferences\n fun setBoolean(key: String, value: Boolean) {\n prefs.edit { putBoolean(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getBoolean(key: String, defaultValue: Boolean = false): Boolean {\n return prefs.getBoolean(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Long preferences\n fun setLong(key: String, value: Long) {\n prefs.edit { putLong(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getLong(key: String, defaultValue: Long = 0L): Long {\n return prefs.getLong(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Float preferences\n fun setFloat(key: String, value: Float) {\n prefs.edit { putFloat(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getFloat(key: String, defaultValue: Float = 0f): Float {\n return prefs.getFloat(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Remove preference\n fun remove(key: String) {\n prefs.edit { remove(key) }\n }\n \n // Clear all preferences\n fun clearAll() {\n prefs.edit { clear() }\n }\n \n // Check if preference exists\n fun contains(key: String): Boolean {\n return prefs.contains(key)\n }\n}"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01TAWR5RmCpGcdx4cGbLxFA2","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,1 +1,80 @@
+package com.apero.testai
 
+import android.content.Context
+import android.content.SharedPreferences
+import androidx.core.content.edit
+
+class SharedPref private constructor(context: Context) {
+ private val prefs: SharedPreferences = PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(context.applicationContext)
+ 
+ companion object {
+ @Volatile
+ private var instance: SharedPref? = null
+ 
+ fun getInstance(context: Context): SharedPref {
+ return instance ?: synchronized(this) {
+ instance ?: SharedPref(context).also { instance = it }
+ }
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ // String preferences
+ fun setString(key: String, value: String) {
+ prefs.edit { putString(key, value) }
+ }
+ 
+ fun getString(key: String, defaultValue: String = ""): String {
+ return prefs.getString(key, defaultValue) ?: defaultValue
+ }
+ 
+ // Int preferences
+ fun setInt(key: String, value: Int) {
+ prefs.edit { putInt(key, value) }
+ }
+ 
+ fun getInt(key: String, defaultValue: Int = 0): Int {
+ return prefs.getInt(key, defaultValue)
+ }
+ 
+ // Boolean preferences
+ fun setBoolean(key: String, value: Boolean) {
+ prefs.edit { putBoolean(key, value) }
+ }
+ 
+ fun getBoolean(key: String, defaultValue: Boolean = false): Boolean {
+ return prefs.getBoolean(key, defaultValue)
+ }
+ 
+ // Long preferences
+ fun setLong(key: String, value: Long) {
+ prefs.edit { putLong(key, value) }
+ }
+ 
+ fun getLong(key: String, defaultValue: Long = 0L): Long {
+ return prefs.getLong(key, defaultValue)
+ }
+ 
+ // Float preferences
+ fun setFloat(key: String, value: Float) {
+ prefs.edit { putFloat(key, value) }
+ }
+ 
+ fun getFloat(key: String, defaultValue: Float = 0f): Float {
+ return prefs.getFloat(key, defaultValue)
+ }
+ 
+ // Remove preference
+ fun remove(key: String) {
+ prefs.edit { remove(key) }
+ }
+ 
+ // Clear all preferences
+ fun clearAll() {
+ prefs.edit { clear() }
+ }
+ 
+ // Check if preference exists
+ fun contains(key: String): Boolean {
+ return prefs.contains(key)
+ }
+}
```

The edit introduced the following new linter errors:
Line 8: Unresolved reference: PreferenceManager

Please fix the linter errors if it is clear how to. Do not make uneducated guesses."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

I'll fix the missing import for PreferenceManager:"}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01K2yqKx9iPEpfcYD1tzg5cc","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"target_file": "app/src/main/java/com/apero/testai/SharedPref.kt", "instructions": "I'm adding the missing import for PreferenceManager", "code_edit": "package com.apero.testai\n\nimport android.content.Context\nimport android.content.SharedPreferences\nimport android.preference.PreferenceManager\nimport androidx.core.content.edit\n\nclass SharedPref private constructor(context: Context) {\n private val prefs: SharedPreferences = PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(context.applicationContext)\n \n companion object {\n @Volatile\n private var instance: SharedPref? = null\n \n fun getInstance(context: Context): SharedPref {\n return instance ?: synchronized(this) {\n instance ?: SharedPref(context).also { instance = it }\n }\n }\n }\n \n // String preferences\n fun setString(key: String, value: String) {\n prefs.edit { putString(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getString(key: String, defaultValue: String = \"\"): String {\n return prefs.getString(key, defaultValue) ?: defaultValue\n }\n \n // Int preferences\n fun setInt(key: String, value: Int) {\n prefs.edit { putInt(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getInt(key: String, defaultValue: Int = 0): Int {\n return prefs.getInt(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Boolean preferences\n fun setBoolean(key: String, value: Boolean) {\n prefs.edit { putBoolean(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getBoolean(key: String, defaultValue: Boolean = false): Boolean {\n return prefs.getBoolean(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Long preferences\n fun setLong(key: String, value: Long) {\n prefs.edit { putLong(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getLong(key: String, defaultValue: Long = 0L): Long {\n return prefs.getLong(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Float preferences\n fun setFloat(key: String, value: Float) {\n prefs.edit { putFloat(key, value) }\n }\n \n fun getFloat(key: String, defaultValue: Float = 0f): Float {\n return prefs.getFloat(key, defaultValue)\n }\n \n // Remove preference\n fun remove(key: String) {\n prefs.edit { remove(key) }\n }\n \n // Clear all preferences\n fun clearAll() {\n prefs.edit { clear() }\n }\n \n // Check if preference exists\n fun contains(key: String): Boolean {\n return prefs.contains(key)\n }\n}"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01K2yqKx9iPEpfcYD1tzg5cc","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -3,4 +3,5 @@
 import android.content.Context
 import android.content.SharedPreferences
+import android.preference.PreferenceManager
 import androidx.core.content.edit
 
@@ -79,2 +80,3 @@
 }
 }
+
```

The edit was successful with no linter errors."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

I've created the SharedPref class for your Android app. This class provides:

- Singleton pattern for efficient shared preferences management
- Methods for all preference types (String, Int, Boolean, Long, Float)
- Secure handling via application context
- Utility methods to remove items and check existence

You can use it in your app like this:

```kotlin
// Get instance
val sharedPref = SharedPref.getInstance(context)

// Save data
sharedPref.setString("user_name", "John")
sharedPref.setInt("user_age", 25)
sharedPref.setBoolean("is_premium", true)

// Retrieve data
val userName = sharedPref.getString("user_name")
val userAge = sharedPref.getInt("user_age")
val isPremium = sharedPref.getBoolean("is_premium")
```"}]}]}

{"id":"a14b088a-3adf-43e4-8c2b-c15d197e0835","name":"Tạo File JSON Chuẩn","timestamp":1748268681021,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"<user_query>
giúp tôi taoj file json chuẩn
</user_query>"}]},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"thinking","thinking":"The user's message is in Vietnamese, and they're asking me to help create a standard JSON file. Based on the context, they're already looking at a JSON file named "beauty_full.json" which appears to be a configuration file for an Android application.

Let me analyze what I understand from the request:
- "giúp tôi taoj file json chuẩn" translates to "help me create a standard JSON file"
- The user seems to want help creating a proper/standard JSON file, or perhaps improving the existing one

The file they're currently looking at appears to be a well-structured JSON file with no obvious syntax errors. It contains configuration information for an Android app including:
- Package names
- Application class paths
- Common configuration settings
- Service configuration
- Ad configuration with various ad IDs

To assist the user, I'll need to understand:
1. Do they want me to create a new JSON file from scratch?
2. Do they want me to validate/improve the existing one?
3. Do they have a specific structure or standard they want to follow?

Since I don't have enough context to determine exactly what they want, I'll help them by explaining what a standard JSON file looks like and offer to help them create one based on their needs.","signature":"EqoBCkgIAxABGAIiQEaDAIj58ah6Wp4AjvXfu/VHRHzHTSeyDuUIR09eYYe46me+dOmkJmnDJCnbIibqWxDyzJcdQifT38fvX96gQeQSDMiBTIlQYJ1DzqGSHBoMuNGYxWVHZBjHj756IjAjl7f7j80bw2WR3TsJukdLA9UyDBtQllAeQRonCN7s9XW3qFLmNt2F/y1yGPCarwwqEDk/KYgZKdflvxmviN/ivNY="},{"type":"text","text":"To help you create a standard JSON file, I'll first explore your current workspace to understand the project structure."}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01G4xg5DPBCBtUntpu2EdCqz","type":"function","function":{"name":"list_dir","arguments":"{"relative_workspace_path": "./", "explanation": "Exploring the root directory to understand the project structure"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"list_dir","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01G4xg5DPBCBtUntpu2EdCqz","content":"Contents of directory:

Tôi đã chuẩn hóa file JSON theo cấu trúc cần thiết cho dự án của bạn. File JSON đã được cập nhật với:

1. Thêm đầy đủ các ID quảng cáo cho tất cả các tính năng
2. Thêm mục `uiConfig` với các cấu hình UI cho các tính năng khác nhau:
 - shareUiConfig
 - allFeatureUiConfig
 - removeBgUiConfig
 - artPremiumUiConfig

3. Thêm mục `subFeatureConfig` để kiểm soát việc bật/tắt các tính năng phụ:
 - enableArt
 - enableArtPremium
 - enableRemoveBg
 - enableBeautyTemplate

File JSON này giờ đây hoàn toàn tương thích với các template Mustache trong dự án của bạn và sẵn sàng để sử dụng."}]}]}
